Topic.Title: Trying to save a Name in Quest. [SOLVED]

Posts.EditableText: Hello, been a while. I'm currently trying to figure out a way to save names that are input into the game. Now while I know how to set up the code for the game to react depending on the input I can't seem to find a way to save something the player inputted. Is there a line of code I'm missing or is it something else?

Posts.EditableText:
> I can't seem to find a way to save something the player inputted

To save a variable, you can put it into an attribute. For example, within a text input or menu section, you could include something like:
```
player.chosen_name = result
```

This sets the `chosen_name` attribute of the object named `player` to the value of the `result` variable. In any code later on, you can then use `player.chosen_name` like any other variable; or include `{player.chosen_name}` in a text string that is going to be printed (object's 'look' response, room description, the string passed to a print statement, etc).

(variable names without a dot in last until the end of the script that uses them. With a dot in, they are attributes, and last as long as the object named before the dot exists)
